docs.lead_paragraph: After the installation of cameras and boards announcing compliance rates, hand washing at an I.C.U. soared, a study shows.

headline.seo: When Watched and Cheered On, I.C.U. Workers Wash Hands More
headline.main: Prevention: Cameras Can Help Ensure Hand Washing
headline.print_headline: Prevention: Cameras Can Help Ensure Hand Washing

docs.abstract: Dr Bruce F Farber study published in journal Clinical Infectious Diseases finds that installing cameras in washrooms is a simple and effective way of getting hospital workers to wash their hands consistently.
docs.snippet: After the installation of cameras and boards announcing compliance rates, hand washing at an I.C.U. soared, a study shows.

docs.lead_paragraph: When ticking off the benefits of physical activity, few of us would include intracellular housecleaning. But a new study suggests that the ability of exercise to speed the removal of garbage from inside our body's cells may be one of its most valuable, if least visible, effects. In the new research, which was published last month in Nature, scientists at the University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center in Dallas gathered two groups of mice. One set was normal, with a finely tuned cellular scrubbing system. The other had been bred to have a blunted cleaning system.

headline.main: Phys Ed: Exercising to Fire Up the Body's Trash Furnaces

docs.abstract: University of Texas researchers publish study in journal Nature finding that exercise increases speed and efficiency of the process by which cells rid themselves of waste materials; study underscores the vital role of intracellular cleanup in improving health and preventing or slowing disease. Photo (M)0

docs.lead_paragraph: When it comes to moving people around in healthy ways, New York City already has a leg up on most cities and towns around the country.
docs.abstract: Safer road designs can slow motor vehicles and separate them from pedestrians and cyclists, and also enhance the physical activity and health of residents.
docs.snippet: Safer road designs can slow motor vehicles and separate them from pedestrians and cyclists, and also enhance the physical activity and health of residents.

docs.lead_paragraph: Federal health officials recommended on Thursday that all boys be routinely vaccinated against infection with human papillomavirus, or HPV.

headline.main: Officials Recommend the HPV Vaccine for All Boys
headline.print_headline: Officials Recommend the HPV Vaccine For All Boys

docs.abstract: Federal health officials recommend that all boys be routinely vaccinated against human papillomavirus, or HPV; since 2006, the vaccine has been recommended for girls and young women, largely because HPV infection can cause cervical cancer, but the vaccine also protects against genital warts in men and women, and lowers the risk of developing head, neck and anal cancers.
docs.snippet: Federal health officials recommended on Thursday that all boys be routinely vaccinated against infection with human papillomavirus, or HPV.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations

headline.main: New Vaccine Recommendations for Boys and Diabetics

docs.abstract: Federal health officials recommended this week that all boys be routinely vaccinated against human papillomavirus, or HPV, and that people with diabetes be vaccinated against hepatitis B.
docs.snippet: Federal health officials recommended this week that all boys be routinely vaccinated against human papillomavirus, or HPV, and that people with diabetes be vaccinated against hepatitis B.

docs.lead_paragraph: The discovery in studies of mice solves a mystery surrounding the disease’s grim march and has immediate implications for developing treatments, researchers said.

headline.seo: Alzheimer’s Spreads in the Brain Like a Virus, Studies Find
headline.main: Path Is Found for the Spread of Alzheimer’s
headline.print_headline: Path Is Found For the Spread Of Alzheimer’s

docs.abstract: Two new studies in mice find Alzheimer's disease seems to spread like an infection from brain cell to brain cell, but instead of viruses or bacteria, what is being spread is a distorted protein known as tau; discovery has immediate implications for developing treatments.
docs.snippet: The discovery in studies of mice solves a mystery surrounding the disease’s grim march and has immediate implications for developing treatments, researchers said.

docs.lead_paragraph: The question is not whether the Global Fund works, but how to ensure it keeps working for years to come.
docs.snippet: The question is not whether the Global Fund works, but how to ensure it keeps working for years to come.

docs.lead_paragraph: If sugar's consumption is linked to the rise in noncommunicable diseases like diabetes and hypertension, and if its effects on the body mimic those of alcohol, should we regulate it to protect public health?
docs.abstract: Dr. Robert Lustig and his co-authors call on the government to class sugar with tobacco and alcohol.
docs.snippet: Dr. Robert Lustig and his co-authors call on the government to class sugar with tobacco and alcohol.
